content.description:
Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes. If the question prompts you to “Calculate,” you must show how you arrived at your final answer.

Aggregate Data
 Value (in millions of dollars)

Consumption spending
 <math alttext="1,000"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Employee compensation
 <math alttext="1,100"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Government spending
 <math alttext="400"><mstyle><mrow><mn>400</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Interest payments
 <math alttext="125"><mstyle><mrow><mn>125</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Investment spending
 <math alttext="300"><mstyle><mrow><mn>300</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Net exports
 <math alttext="-100"><mstyle><mrow><mn>-100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Profits
 <math alttext="200"><mstyle><mrow><mn>200</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Rents
 <math alttext="175"><mstyle><mrow><mn>175</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Savings
 <math alttext="400"><mstyle><mrow><mn>400</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

The table above shows aggregate statistical data for Country <math alttext="X"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in <math alttext="2018"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2018</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Assume  the <math alttext="G D P"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> deflator is <math alttext="160"><mstyle><mrow><mn>160</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(a) Calculate the nominal <math alttext="G D P"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in <math alttext="2018"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2018</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Show your work.

(b) Explain why the income approach for calculating <math alttext="G D P"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> yields the same value as the expenditure approach to calculating <math alttext="G D P"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(c) Explain one difference between the <math alttext="C P I"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CPI</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and the <math alttext="G D P"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> deflator.

(d) Using the <math alttext="G D P"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> deflator, calculate real <math alttext="G D P"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="2018"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2018</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Show your work.

(e) Assume wheat farmers in Country <math alttext="X"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> sold their entire crop of wheat to domestic wheat millers, who sold it to domestic bakeries. If the value of wheat farmers’ sales is <math alttext="$10"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> million, the value of wheat millers’ sales is <math alttext="$25"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>25</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> million, and the value of bakeries’ sales is <math alttext="$65"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>65</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> million, by how much would Country <math alttext="X"><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></math>'s nominal <math alttext="G D P"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> change as a result of this transaction? Explain.
content.question: Respond to all parts of the question.

frqParts.text: Respond to all parts of the question.

unit.text: 2: Economic Indicators and the Business Cycle

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe economic concepts, principles, or models.
